meanings.definition: A person who works jointly on an activity or project.
meanings.sent1: The talented artist was a key collaborator in the mural painting.
meanings.sent2: The team leader assigned each member a specific role as a collaborator.
meanings.sent3: The collaborator brought their own unique style to the group project.
meanings.sent4: In the kitchen, each ingredient acted as a collaborator in creating the delicious dish.
meanings.sent5: The successful business relied on the hard work of every collaborator to thrive.

meanings.definition: An associate in an activity or endeavor.
meanings.sent1: The young musician found a talented collaborator to help with the songwriting.
meanings.sent2: The research team welcomed a new collaborator to assist with the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The two friends became collaborators on a fun weekend project.
meanings.sent4: The sun and the clouds seemed like collaborators in painting the sky with colors.
meanings.sent5: The detective and the scientist worked together as collaborators to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: One who cooperates traitorously with an enemy.
meanings.sent1: The spy acted as a collaborator, secretly sharing information with the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The double agent was revealed as a collaborator working against their own country.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky collaborator pretended to be loyal while plotting against the group.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure operated as a collaborator, causing chaos from within.
meanings.sent5: The traitorous collaborator's actions led to the downfall of the alliance.
